page.title: 03ECOLOGY AROUND COILACRIECH
page.content: 1. Coniferous woodlands Most of the trees in the area have been planted by man, as is evidenced by the fact that they are planted in straight lines, and are close together, resulting in tall straight tree trunks. However, a small area on the south Deeside road is semi-natural pinewood, probably self seeded from a plantation or perhaps a decendant of the old Caladonian pine forest. These are the trees that characterize a large part of upper Deeside. They have much more space to grow laterally than trees in plantations and consequently twist themselves into weird and wonderful shapes.
